intro: Geijera latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf geijera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive broad shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, woody fruits. It is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Geijera latifolia is often used in landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
